data.title: Mikey Urso - 2019 - Men's Lacrosse
data.meta_description: Mikey Urso (32) A  - Redshirt-Senior (2019): Played in all 15 games, making 15 starts…recorded 23 goals and 19 assists for 42 points…took 56 shots
data.text:
Redshirt-Senior (2019): Played in all 15 games, making 15 starts…recorded 23 goals and 19 assists for 42 points…took 56 shots with a 75% shots on goal percentage…graduated as program leader in points.

R-Junior (2018): Appeared in all 15 games, starting 12 in the attack...tabbed to the All-Sunshine State Conference Second Team...became the program's all-time leader in career assists...broke his own single-season school record with 24 assists...ranked second in the SSC at 1.60 assists per game and seventh at 2.87 points per game...led the team with 43 points behind 19 goals and 24 assists...ranked third on the team with 40 ground balls...held team-bests in shot percentage (47.5%) and shots-on-goal percentage (85.0%)...had six points in the season opener vs. Mars Hill (2/17), logging two goals and four helpers...tallied two goals and five assists vs. Westminster (Utah) (3/13) for a career-high-tying seven points…had another seven-point game vs. Florida Southern (3/31), posting a career-high-tying four goals with three assists.

R-Sophomore (2017): Played in all 13 games in his second season at Lynn, making eight starts…began the year as a starting attack before transitioning to an offensive midfielder…named to the All-Sunshine State Conference First Team…broke the single-season school record with 20 assists…ranked third in the SSC in assists per game…ranked second on the squad with 41 points and tied for second with 21 goals…hit the frame on 68.7% of his shots…tied for second on the team with 28 ground balls…forced five turnovers…logged at least one point in all but one game…strung together three consecutive hat tricks midway through the season and four straight games with four or more points…had seven points on two separate occasions; (4G, 3A) vs. Lees-McRae (2/11) in the season opener and (3G, 4A) at Walsh (3/20)...earned SSC Commissioner Honor Roll recognition for earning a 3.2 grade point average or better.

R-Freshman (2016): Started all 14 games in the attack as a redshirt-freshman in his first season in the Blue and White…named to the Sunshine State Conference All-Freshman Team…tied for second on the team in points (44), goals (28) and assists (16)…ranked top-10 in the SSC in points, goals and assists per game…fired off 64 shots with 45 on-goal for a team-high .703 shots-on-goal percentage…registered a team-high shooting percentage, scoring on 43.8% of his attempts…picked up 21 ground balls…recorded at least one point in every game…tallied a hat trick in each of his first three games as a Fighting Knight…had nine multi-goal games on the season and six outings with at least three goals…made his Lynn debut in the season opener, posting five points on three goals and two assists against Shorter (2/13)…posted a season-high six points behind four goals and two helpers in the win over MIT (3/23)...earned SSC Commissioner Honor Roll recognition for earning a 3.2 grade point average or better.

Prior to Lynn: Redshirted his freshman campaign at Mount St. Mary’s University.

High School: Named First Team All-District three times at nearby Pope John Paul II…earned all-region honors twice and was an All-American his senior season…played four years on the varsity, serving as team captain the final two.

Personal: Born September 20, 1996...son of Phil and Deborah…majoring in criminal justice…has a brother, Brian.
